intro: Enckea subpanduriformis, commonly known as the panduriform enckea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in humid tropical forests and is often found in areas with well-drained soil. Its botanical features include a slender stem, trifoliate leaves, and pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Enckea subpanduriformis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
